1.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
to be pungent; i.e. in taste (sour, i.e. literally fermented, or figuratively, harsh), in color (dazzling)
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to swell up (literally or figuratively, active or passive); by implication, to favor or honour, be high or proud
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
to tip over (for the purpose of spilling or pouring out), i.e. (figuratively) depopulate; by implication, to imprison or conquer; (reflexive) to lie down (for coitus)
vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

2.brief: a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
a wine-press (or vat for holding the grapes in pressing them)

3.brief: to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
to tread; by implication, to walk; also to string abow (by treading on it in bending)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to tread upon (as a potter, in walking or abusively)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
to spirt, i.e. besprinkle (especially in expiation)
juice of the grape (as blood red)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a year (as a revolution of time)
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

5.brief: to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to surround, i.e. protect or aid
to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to prop (literally or figuratively); reflexively, to lean upon or take hold of (in a favorable or unfavorable sense)

6.brief: a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
to become tipsy; in a qualified sense, to satiate with astimulating drink or (figuratively) influence
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
juice of the grape (as blood red)

7.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
good (as a noun), in the widest sense, especially goodness (superlative concretely, the best), beauty, gladness, welfare
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to treat a person (well or ill), i.e. benefit or requite; by implication (of toil), to ripen, i.e. (specifically) to wean
compassion (in the plural); by extension, the womb (as cherishing the fetus); by implication, a maiden
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

8.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to cheat, i.e. be untrue (usually in words)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor

9.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to be open, wide or free, i.e. (by implication) to be safe; causatively, to free or succor
{affection (in a good or a bad sense)}

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
to lift; by implication, to impose
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

10.brief: to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke)
properly, to carve, i.e. fabricate or fashion; hence (in a bad sense) to worry, pain or anger
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to feed on; figuratively, to consume; by implication, to battle (as destruction)

11.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

12.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

13.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
a horse (as leaping); also a swallow (from its rapid flight)
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to totter or waver (through weakness of the legs, especially the ankle); by implication, to falter, stumble, faint or fall

14.brief: properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
properly, a split, i.e. a wide level valley between mountains

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)

15.brief: to scan, i.e. look intently at; by implication, to regard with pleasure, favor or care
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
force (literally or figuratively); by implication, valor, victory
a noise, tumult, crowd; also disquietude, wealth

used only in plural the intestines, or (collectively) the abdomen, figuratively, sympathy; by implication, a vest; by extension the stomach, the uterus (or of men, the seat of generation), the heart (figuratively)
compassion (in the plural); by extension, the womb (as cherishing the fetus); by implication, a maiden
near, with or among; often in general, to

16.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
Abraham, the later name of Abram
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character

17.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to vacillate, i.e. reel or stray (literally or figuratively); also causative of both
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
fear (also used as infinitive); morally, reverence
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion

18.brief: petty (in size or number); adverbially, a short (time)
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum
